intro: Encelia soratensis, commonly known as the desert encelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Encelia soratensis is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local wildlife.
